meanings.definition: A yellow or brown pigment found in plants and algae.
meanings.sent1: The xanthophyll in the flower petals gives them a bright yellow color.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the xanthophyll under a microscope to understand its properties.
meanings.sent3: The xanthophyll in the garden seemed to make the plants glow in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a xanthophyll, bringing warmth and brightness to the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist used xanthophyll to create a stunning painting of the sunset.

meanings.definition: Any of various yellow pigments occurring in the leaves of plants.
meanings.sent1: During autumn, the xanthophyll in the leaves changes their color to yellow.
meanings.sent2: The xanthophyll in the tree leaves helps in the process of photosynthesis.
meanings.sent3: The xanthophyll in the salad made it look like a bowl of sunshine.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was as bright as xanthophyll, spreading joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The xanthophyll in the forest leaves created a beautiful golden carpet on the ground.
